caption: Love it! The food is fresh and the customer service is amazing 10/10

What an amazing experience! My first time eating in the Walnut Room, but not my last. We were there yesterday for lunch, and our server, Fawn, was delightful. The chicken chili soup was incredible, and the garlic bread was just about the best I've had in my entire life. I of course wanted to have the chicken pot pie, since it was the first dish ever served there (more than 110 years ago) and it was excellent! My daughter had the mandarin salad, and was very pleased. Lattes and cappucinos to drink - both delicious. Great atmosphere, reasonable prices, excellent service - five stars from beginning to end!

Amazing food. Went on valentines day and everyone was so friendly and kind, wishing us a nice holiday, smiling, waving at us, making sure we were happy.. best restaurant I've been to in Chicago.  Had the chicken pot pie, garlic bread, mimosa flight, and the white chocolate bread pudding.  Everything 10/10. Amazing food and such good service and an amazing atmosphere. Want to go back tomorrow.
Closedown, you can still take look!
Walnut Room is closed.   Sales were great!  Lots of Franco at 50 off left.
Closed but beautiful
Beautiful Christmas decoration

What a lovely place to eat! Dice you can't eat in person right now they still allow you to enjoy the Christmas tree and take food to go!!! We always eat here while visiting downtown, would highly recommend!!
Great food & beautiful decor!
Great restaurant
So beautiful at Christmas especially
Great Experience
Great food!
This place never disappoints!
Great menu and kids menu! The cheese platter was amazing. Our waiter was perfectly attentive to my little one. Beautiful building. The bathrooms were disappointing (reason for missing star).
Excellent  food  pairing  with prisoner  winery,  the chef really out did herself.
great place with great service

My Daughter and I had dinner at the Walnut Room last Saturday, February 15, 2020, before a concert. The service and food were excellent. I have food allergies and they were happy to change their recipe to fit my needs. We can’t wait to visit again.

If I could give this place no stars I would.. my bf and I spent Valentines Day here on 2/14/20. We got there at 6:30pm we watched as other servers go to other people’s tables. So 8:00pm comes and still no one. People that came in after us were getting served. The lady at the front apologized for the wait and gave us free bread and 50% off our food. We were like okay that’s awesome! NO! It took 30mins to get the bread and it was cold in the middle, We still never got a server nor food. 8:45pm comes and we finally get our food. They gave us the food for free but it wasn’t worth the wait nor being free. My food looked like it was something someone sent back in the kitchen and it tasted spoil, my bf meal looked over cooked but our food was extremely cold. Never going back there again.
Came during the holidays and it was fun. Enjoyed some wine and a Yule log cake. The tree was definitely a sight to see.
The Walnut Room is a classic place to dine. The staff is amazing and the views out the windows are great. They have an Impossible Burger that I recommend.

What the.... this was the strangest dining experience ever. I was told I had to go here on my visit to Chicago.  The tree is cool,  but the hostesses are unprofessional and pretty rude. We had a table for 2 that was on the main thoroughfare of everyone being seated that barely had enough room for people to get through so literally everyone who walks by feels awkward and ends up inadvertently touching the table. That table wouldn’t be there at all in any other restaurant. The food is decent. The waitstaff is nice. The red lighting feels like a horror movie and then the fairy godmothers top off the trippy bizarro atmosphere. It’s really a shame that the vents on the second level haven’t been cleaned- they make the room feel dirty and that’s an easy fix. The upper levels of the room really need some TLC to bring it up to par for the historic value that it has.  I can’t believe how popular dining here is. It must just be nostalgia, but the facility is certainly not maintaining the whole space as it should be. It honestly felt like a scene from The Shining. The red lights are just awful. It’s so creepy.  It was still worth it. It was certainly an experience we won’t forget and was highly amusing. Such a historic landmark deserves a better overall staff that appreciates the history and can behave professionally.
Great food. Great experience.
The buffet is great. The customer service was great. And the desert was wonderful.
Top notch
Fantastic prime rib buffet, for only $30 USD during the holiday season, along with the ambience of the Walnut Room's Christmas tree in the middle of the restaurant.
Brian, our waiter, was great. Our food was delicious. An overall pleasant experience.

The Walnut Room was a holiday tradition in our family back when it was part of Marshall Fields. I hadn't been here since maybe 1987. Got in fairly easily with a group of 12, with 5 kids. The buffet was good for the kids. Adults all had entrees. Most had salads, which looked pretty good. I had the meatloaf which was pretty tasty and about a perfect portion, just enough. The Walnut Old Fashioned cocktail was too sweet for my tastes, but it had a fantastic walnut flavor. The Fairy Princess shtick was entertaining for the little girls we had with us 2, 6, 7, 8, and 10. And of course the enormous Christmas Tree in the main room was a hit with the adults. Good holiday family dinner for a special night out with the kids.

I am going to preface this review with The Walnut Room has been one of my favorite hidden gems in Chicago for most of my life and I go every holiday season with my family and get a collectible holiday mug.  This year, the menu was drastically reduced and did not include my favorite: the field's special nor did it include my favorite cinnamon holiday drink, which was the start of my troubles today. I ordered something else, the eggnog brandy drink, but promptly returned it. My waitress informed me that I no longer qualified for my mug 😡. I asked to speak to a manager because that was the last straw for me. After about 15 min my waitress came back and told me that THE MANAGER DIDN'T HAVE TIME TO COME AND SPEAK TO ME!! She did give me a holiday mug, and I don't fault her for lack of service, but I am disgusted at the fact that this institution would disrespect their patrons that way. ALWAYS make time for a customer who asks to see a manager, you never know what they may have to say, who they are, OR WHO THEY KNOW.

We waited 4+ hours for a table for two. The place was chaos, with conflicting information being given about where to go, wait times, and people seating themselves. This used to be a lovely holiday tradition, but something has changed this year for the worse.

Attempted to make a reservation online but it says booked. So I tried calling the number on their website which takes you to a recording and then a full mailbox so you can't leave a msg. 9/10 times opentable is wrong, if you call directly you can get a reservation. Perfect example is Cafe Babareeba. Every time I try opentable it says booked, when I call the restaurant I get a reservation no problem. This has happened easily 2 or 3 times a year for like 8 yrs now. What a let down. Better luck next year I guess?  Also on the Macy's site if you try to access the walnut room page it leads you to a network solutions page, meaning they haven't paid their web host bill or didn't update their links. Seems like a poorly run operation.  I'll update this review once they fix their issues...
Limited menu, Wisconsin Asiago Chicken was good.
Awesome Experience 5 stars.  Loved the chicken Asiago!
Delicious food, crazy prices.  But still worth it for a fun Holiday meal.
Excellent experience. The buffet was wonderful and so was our server, Lavita.
Food was absolutely garbage. $30 for some aldi brand buffet. Servers were good for how many people were smooshed into this  big dining hall. Would recommend Wendy's before going here.
The lobster soup was salty and its chicken was dry, the service was ok..
Iconic
Beautiful!!!!!

A tradition spent at the Walnut room year over year.  this year in its infinite wisdom Walnut room decided to turn everything into a buffet.  If you truly enjoy a very expensive old country buffet you may find yourself at home. Thank you Walnut room for ruining a elegant meal yearly tradition with family.  Way to put profit over customer service.
Good food
I loved the meatloaf and mashed potatoes with red pepper gravy. Delicious squash soup or lobster bisque. Lovely decor for holiday season. Look forward to visit every December.
Located on the 7th floor in Macy’s. Beautiful decorations. Great drink selections (about $10/drink). Haven’t tried the food here yet but it looks good. Great place to enjoy the Xmas spirit.
Brings back many memories. Always a good place to have a meal.
If you want a place to go that has history and beauty and food and service is number one this is the place to check out especially Christmas time it will blow your mind it's beautiful

Enjoyed the holiday buffet. Everything was delicious. What a great idea! (I would separate appetizers, soups and salads from the main course items... had to wait through the apps/soups/salad line to get to main course.)

The Walnut Room is beautiful, the tree is great, food, drink, service is great. Too bad Macy’s only “validates” $3 for parking across the street, which unless you use a parking app, could cost you $50 for 2 hours.

While the food at the Walnut room is good, especially the chicken pot pie, it really is the view of the city from above that makes the experience. I went during Christmas, and the atmosphere is unbeatable at that time. Wonderful experience.
Very sad, it is only a shadow of its' former self. I should have left it as a memory.

I always loved the experience here as a child and even as a young adult the last I was there about 18 years ago.  My favorites were the chicken pot pie, Fields  sharp cheddar cheese soup and the Fields Frango mint pie.  I also had a salad there once with great sesame dressing.
Amazing, but dated.

I can't believe this was my first visit to the infamous Walnut Room.  It definitely takes you back in time.  Food was delicious and reasonably priced.  Service was a little slow, so if you are going before a show, plan accordingly.
It's sad to see this place is always empty. The food is cheap and delicious.  Go for the Pot pie and the Cheesy garlic bread.

Great food, beautiful  atmosphere and located in Macy's on State Street so you can shop and then get lunch. Busy around Christmas but a great place to take the kids during the holidays. Don't forget to check out the windows.

Sad but true... an iconic establishment ruined by Macy's and the parent company.  Someday within the hierarchy of management someone will recognize the importance of bringing the The Walnut room back to what it once was. The signature chicken pot pie was no better than a chicken soup. Gone are the succulent pieces of chicken with fresh vegetables and a pastry crust that made the presentation one of a kind.  Paper over the cloth table cloth make this establishment nothing more than a glorified cafeteria.
Tge best food and service

I was at the Walnut Room for the Sunday brunch! I had a great salad with frisee, mixed greens, and all type of vegetables; it was excellent. Also the kitchen and wait staffs were very professional. Also, it was a nice to shop in the store after the branch. I look forward to going back when they put up the Christmas decorations. I highly recommend this place for tourists and locals alike.

The singer Lorin Paige voice was the first thing I heard as the elevator doors opened. PERFECT ARTIST FOR THIS SPACE! My goodness, it’s so beautiful! The customer service was great! The food was seasoned perfectly! The views from the windows are so scenic!  I had the pleasure of eating brunch today for my birthday at the walnut room and was in awe! I’ll definitely be back! I hope Lorin is there!
Average food, just ok. If you're already in Macy's, it's a good lunch spot, but don't go out of your way.
Food is average but really fun to go at Christmas time
The garlic cheese bread is to die for. So sinful. The best I've had.
A peaceful, hidden gem of a restaurant that allows people to relax over some good food in a great atmosphere amid the hustle of the city.*  *This doesn't apply during the holidays.
Great place to bring the family, great food and good people excellent service.
Over priced, meh food.
The elevators took forever. And they forgot to serve our soup.

There are four pokestops while you eat and the food is good. I was there for the sunday all you can eat brunch and the food was EXCELLENT. Nothing like all you can eat food and all you can catch pokemon.
Exceptional service and food. Had the brunch buffet and was reasonably priced.
Mediocre food, especially dessert.

Have not been there in a coons years .... That and the Narcissus Room and on the children's menus was the chicken croquettes aka "the Little Red Hen" was our favorite .... The white gravy with peas and carrots and "smashed potatoes" !
Classic Chicago, at Christmas give me my real Santa, Frango mints and lunch here.
Great Food. GREAT People, Great Place! Like you have never seen before.
Best Arnold Palmer ever.
Love the place went for Christmas Brunch

A true hidden gem! If you like architecture and excellent food check out Macy's on State St! Love the chicken pot pie and we will dedinitely be back for the Sunday brunch! Best buffet I've ever had, I am not a big fan of buffets.
Great Mother's Day Buffet

I love the Walnut room. Have been coming here for many years. Staff is friendly. Always willing to help and be accommodating. We celebrated my daughters college graduation brunch here. Staff came by to say congrats. We had a party of 13. Our waiter answered everyone's questions on food and drinks. They made my daughters day. The Frango Pie is my favorite.
Great food and service
Always great food, drinks, and service!
It's an iconic space, worth the visit but a shadow of it's former glory. Food was good, waitstaff very attentive.
Great Brunch Buffet! Jesus was great and made sure our empty plates were taken and glasses were ways full.

The food was amazing. The duck leg and waffle was outstanding. Cynthia served us some really good drinks. If you are a whiskey drinker, the classic old fashion was one of the best I’ve tried. I’d recommend this spot to any foodie.
Good food, nice place,awesome experience!

It's tasty and simple "Grandma" food that hits the spot.  Fairly, inexpensive for the portion size and considering the history that comes with being in a 100 year old restaurant.  Had a wonderful experience at the Walnut Room and will be back for future lunches.
Chicken pot pie was amazing.
Very nice spot at this historic location. I had the chicken. It was very delicious. My party had the pot pie. Everyone raved on it. I surely want to go back for their brunch.
Very good food. Great service too.
Always classy. Like a little piece of Marshall Fields is still there.
Amazing place to have lunch mainly during Xmas and Spring season for its decoration

Came here for the buffet by the Christmas Tree. It was a great price for what you get. I don't know if it's just the nostalgia of being here or what but it just feels like such a fun experience. The wait list is easy to get on and get get updates for.
Chicken pot pie and salad -- dreamy!

A CHICAGO MUST! As a native Chicagoan and tour guide, I can tell you The Walnut Room is rich in Chicago history. For generations, families and friends have said, "I'll meet you at the Walnut Room!" You can hardly get a table at holiday times but it is always worth the wait. In the hallways near and surrounding, there are plenty of photos and artifacts to enjoy while you wait. I enjoyed brunch this past Sunday. The room is currently managed by Gino and you won't find a more genial host who cares more about maintaining the grand reputation he inherited with his job. Well done, Gino and your team! Thank you!
Wonderful place for the family around Thanksgiving or Christmas.
Traditional Chicago!!!

The food was amazing. I have been here several times, and the food always tastes good. My favorite is the Chicken Pot Pie and the Frango mint pie.  For Chicago, the prices are also reasonable. However, service was terrible. Another table was seated after me and they received their food, ate, and paid before my main food came.   We also did not receive our drinks in a timely manner.  The staff seemed to have checked out mentally. They were very depressed and did not appear to want to be there.  If you go to the Walnut Room, go for the food, but give yourself lots of extra time, because the service is terrible.  Also, since the top floor has been sold, you can no longer see the Christmas tree. You can only see it if you eat at the restaurant.  This is a big disappointment, and will affect my visits to Macy's and the Walnut Room in the future. With the poor service and the inability to see the tree and other stunning displays in the restaurant, there is no reason to visit.
Used to be a great place to eat, but then in 2018 they changed to a buffet. My little brother found 3 hairs in his food. The food was bland and the service seemed passive aggressive.
Always a very lovely experience at the Walnut Room!!

The food ranged from fair to good. Service was slow & totally missed the mark. There were 3 of us dining on a Thursday at 6:00pm, not a busy time. The hostess sat us and gave us only 2 menus. We were sat in the center of the room around the art projects, which had led color shifting lights. We found the lights too bright and distracting.  The server was nice. We got ice water, diet coke and iced tea. We were never offered refills at any time from any of the waitstaff. Our orders were simple but took almost 45 minutes. One of the items was wrong. Our guest received the skirt steak salad instead of the sandwich. No compensation was made to the bill.  Another guest asked for ketchup. An easy ask that wasn't filled until we waylaid another staff member to get it 15 minutes later.  All in all, the Walnut Room has gone downhill from previous years and we will pass on eating there again. Very disappointed!
Had late lunch there when at the flower show at Macys very good.
It classic.
The service was amazing and the food was so good!
Have always loved going there at Xmas time. It is very festive and a tradition with our family.
Beautiful Room

It was a Christmas ritual. An afternoon meal in the Walnut Room. Everything associated with it. Each moment Increased anticipation. Part of the joy. Before. The clock at State and Washington.  Window shopping at Marshall Fields. The chill in the air. Snowflakes whirling in the wind. Coming inside. Up to the seventh floor. The wait never mattered.  A lovely formal space with that resplendent Christmas tree. Not just paneled with wood. Rich intricately grained English Circassian Walnut. Austrian Crystal fixtures. A refined place that commands proper comportment yet the visiting fairies, the fairy dust and festive decorations make the occasion a delight. In the past I enjoyed à la carte Lobster Bisque. The Original Mrs Hering Chicken Pot Pie. Frango Mint Ice Cream Pie. I did not care for the change to buffet, nor the odd lighting - which took away from the elegant simplicity of the Tree being the highlight. Also found the attitude of the help not up to the previous standard of service. Before - no reservations. Sure it got crowded, the wait could be long, the room noisy at times. No matter. Each year I came was special - because of who I was with. What we were doing. The time of year. Fields had a style, a strategy, a tradition of excellence it upheld. Felt differently after Fields closed.  Now so clearly a Macy's restaurant.  Previously so ingrained as a part of my personal rituals that I thought nothing can change that special feeling. That impeccable grace and gentility. Here. At the Walnut Room. At Christmas.
Classic
A classic

We came here because it was highly recommended. Its a fancy restaurant and our out of state guest enjoyed the place, the location, ambiance and most importantly the food. Its a pricey restaurant but so worth it.  They're chef came out to check how we enjoyed our meal and the servers were so attentive and friendly. Would definitely come back here and recommend this place.
Christmas is magical there

We travel to Chicago every year around Christmas and the Walnut Room has become a part of our holiday tradition. It is a place that adds a celebratory mood to our visits. Good food, good service, love the family, holiday, vibe
Went at Christmas time to see the tree and have dinner. Had the buffet. The food was very fresh and tasty and there was a good variety. The staff was very friendly and competent.
our Christmas tradition love it an new this past year Buffet under the Christmas tree! 🤶🏻🎅🏻
The selection of food was amazing and the waiters were very attentive.
Loved It
A Christmas tradition to have lunch under the tree at the Walnut Room
Love the Xmas lunch. Yearly trip with God children. Great tradition
My Mom and I had a great lunch, good service at the Walnut Room.
Always a great visit!
They have several vegetarian options, including two Impossible Burger entrees.
Christmas tradition. Long, long wait. Buffet was tasty and had many offerings. Tree was beautiful.
Best Christmas in a long time because of this place
Cool view from any seat and great lunch specials

There is a somewhat confusing way to get in, paging and waiting again, but the fairy princesses were amazing and the ambiance is beautiful!! My children loved looking out the window onto the city below!! Its a great experience!

Food is amazing. Service is good. Princesses walking around add to the fun ambiance. Good place to take kids because of that. Little expensive. The only bad part is that on a weekend, especially around Christmas time the wait is 4-5 hours. Why they don't expand into the rest of Macy's that is slowly dying anyways, I will never understand.
(Translated by Google) Elegant and historic  (Original) Elegante e histórico
A great place for a Christmas luncheon that is very special.
A Chicago classic.  Have gone for lunch many times and always enjoy the experience.  Went this time for happy hour at the bar.  Prices and service was perfect.
Very accomodating staff.  Food was excellent and service was great.  Very much appreciated complimentary drink with buffet.

Had wonderful experience and deli food on Christmas 2018. In two days decided to go there again and was terribly unsatisfied with waiter Manny. Cold food, bad seats, $20 wrongly charged check. Oh, he also didn’t bring gift mugs as every other waiter did.
Lovely views. Beautifully decorated tree. Meh service. Salty food.

Terrible  very dreary looked like it was closed. Been eating pot pies from there since I Was little girl. It was horrible loaded with Onions. Wont ever order that  again nothing Compensated for horrible tasting meal. Sure glad my food allergies didn't kick in.
(Translated by Google) Full immersion in American traditions! The famous chicken pot pie!  (Original) Full immersion nelle tradizioni americane! La famosa chicken pot pie!
The Buffet is the best here, I am impressed with the crews very nice and accommodating . Best food so far ")

Waited over an hour for our food.  The Food was great, but service awfull.  THE ORIGINAL bar order took more than 30 minutes, and was wrong with 4 mistakes besides waiting yet again and waiting again for the new order when he only brought 1 drink out of 4 at which 1 cancelled and waited, again for the reorder of wines. The waiting never stopped,  over 35 minutes for our checks. Management came asked if all was alright, when told what was happening did nothing. Didn't check on our order in the kitchen or bar. Didn't come back with food or drink. Let the waiter Brian who was differently overwhelmed to hang in the wind on his own.

Historic dining room paneled in walnut. Good food reasonably priced and is family-friendly.  I definitely suggest having dinner during the holidays under the huge Christmas tree. A small child's delight.  Note: since our last visit, the store has closed off the upper floors. You can no longer see the Christmas tree from up above.

Went after christmas settled down. A nice slow Sunday evening. Service was pretty good. I had the Impossible (Veggie) Patty Melt. It was really great and good hearty vegetarian food which I rarely get. I would return.
Classic surroundings but spirit lagging. Reduced menu from what I remember. Food good but not great. Prices reasonable. Longing for Marshall Fields.
A tradition to be sure. The food is fair, and the service is slow, but the venue is spectacular. The fairy princesses at Christmas are still the best.
The tree was great, service excellent, but the food was not as impressive. It is a key stopping place, but probably not for foodies.
Great anbience. Great food. Prices were very very reasonable. The deserts were not as good as they looked though.
Festive fun during holidays.
Great experience

Definitely a place to visit around the holidays. They have a huge tree that has a theme every year. Their menu is on the smaller side, but a lot of comfort foods like chicken pot pie. They had an all you can eat buffet this year which allowed you to taste many different options from the menu. A lot of great holiday cocktails as well! Ask to get a seat near the tree, but during the holidays, the wait can be upwards of 2 hours. Reservations for the holidays open around early November and book up pretty quickly so be on the lookout! It does run after Christmas as well which tends to be less crowded.

Really sad to see this place go downhill. Been going here every year for Christmas dinner as a family tradition. The past few years we have experienced cold food served , pieces of plastic bags in the mashed potatoes, undercooked meat and vegetables, cocktails ordered at the beginning of the meal coming out well after the entrees were served, service that repeatedly said "saLmon" (hard L), incorrect drinks/food and just overall terrible food and service. It was a top grade restaurant back when Marshall Fields owned it, now its an over priced TGI Fridays. Complaints are usually met with surprise and apologies and maybe some comped drinks, but for the price we shouldn't be complaining about the same things for several years in a row. Their beautiful tree can be viewed from the floor above, no need to waste your money eating in front of it when there are hundreds of restaurants in the area with much better food, drinks and service. We have unfortunately put an end to a 30+ year tradition after this year.
I had the buffet lunch in the Walnut room. It was delicious with a large variety of food and desserts. Beautifully displayed.
Good food.  The service was perfect.  The view and ambiance are the best here.  Going during the holiday is just magical.  The tree is just perfect!
Great waiter!

Disappointed!  The staff was more interested in socializing with each other rather than working.  They were all hanging out at the hostess stand. It was so crazy, I actually took pictures.  Not sure where the manager was, but clearly not there. Food was ok, but not frequently replaced.  Buffet table was very messy.

Hadn't been to the Walnut Room in years so it was nice to return to continue family memories with my own family from when I was a child. Food was good, however, the mashed potatoes felt like I was licking a salt stick and I couldn't finish them unfortunately. The rest of the buffet was great - we had a nice time.
Service and decor was nice...food wasn't as stellar as I expected
The Restaurant is showing it's age unfortunately
I work their as a buffet attendent

The staff is always very friendly and patient with people.  The new wait system was perfect for this Christmas season.  The food is just ok, I really come more for the experience, during the Christmas season.   This year they did a buffet, and I much prefer that option.  This is my early tradition, so I will be back next year.

The new buffet caught me off guard, since I've been going to the Walnut Room since I was a little girl. The selection was great, and you are given the option to try almost everything that's on the individual menu.
Delicious a family tradition
Beautiful room,  especially at Christmastime with the tree and decorations. Floors could have been cleaner. Overall,  a nice way to share some Holiday meal.

I know this place is a Chicago landmark for Christmas time, but I don't really see the hype. The food is ok, the drinks overpriced, and Macy's has completely smeared their name over a Chicago staple worse than Willis did with Sears. The wait staff is pretty friendly, I just don't see this place worth the money. You can get bang for your buck elsewhere.
The tree was different and beautiful.
A holiday must!

This restaurant is a staple in my partner’s family Christmas traditions, however, this year instead of the regular menu they had a buffet set up. The food was good and the tree was fantastic but it was a bit chaotic with the buffet.
Great atmosphere, great food

We took in The Walnut Room buffet option during the Christmas season using the walk up to lock in a spot on the wait list for lunch. We reported for seating soon as we received and notification to be seated immediately. The salad and hot food was tasty with plenty to eat. Deserts were good too. I'd compare to a decent hotel buffet. Restaurant space is rather packed, so be patient with service and navigating around. Worth a stop as a treat during the holiday season.

Lovely pre-Christmas evening. The service is the real take-away, fun and professional. Food is pretty good, especially for a buffet. Some parts were better than others. Great decorations and lighting.
Great buffet and service! Like the good ol days!

The chicken pot pie never disappoints. It is served with a spinach salad tossed in a white creamy dressing. They have a great unsweetened iced tea, and they have a nice variety of cocktails and a decent beer and wine selection. Christmas isn't complete without a visit to The Walnut Room.
It was my first ime in this place and I falled in love. Beatiful place and delicious food. This is place is magic in Christmas Times.
This year they did  buffet. Preferred the full menu.
(Translated by Google) Buffet 47.00 for  (Original) Buffet 47.00 per
Does not have the same sophistication and charm as the days of Marshall Field's. The great tree is still impressive and the buffet has variety.
This is just about the worst run restaurant I've ever been to everything was a disorganized mess and an unpleasant experience. The food wasn't anything special, and the atmosphere was plain awful.
Nice service, really long wait though, but it was worth it

Our reservations were for 4:30. Waited 15 min. But when we got into the dining room all the tables away from the tree were empty anyway.  Service was ok but the food was not good. There were 4 entrees to choose from or 26.00 for a buffet. Pot pie, breaded chicken, salmon, or meat loaf. I had soup and salad but the salad was a wedge of lettuce with two uncut slices spread over the top on a bed of marble rye bread buttered and two slices of cheese on the bread.  Thin slice of tomato, boiled egg and one black olive on a skewer.  Weirdest dashboard I've ever had.  Chicken was good but served with boxed mashed and 4 green beans.  Nice tree but good was not worth it.....

Great food and atmosphere, not so great service. The meatloaf was delicious and their iconic Christmas tree was beautiful. Our server was kind, but really struggled to keep up and the restaurant really wasn’t all that busy. One of the people in our group didn’t even get their plate of food with the rest of us. We had to ask to get it and that was nearly 20 min after the rest of us got our plates. We had to ask for refills because we hardly saw our server and she took 10 or more min to return to our table after we asked for something. There was also black specs floating in some of our water glasses. LARGE GROUPS BEWARE - the restaurant won’t split checks and only takes up to three separate card payments. Figure out your payments ahead of time.

Maybe because it was later at night and the magic was gone for the day but The Walnut Room and Macy's are not aging well. It may have been easier to notice because the holiday throngs weren't present to hide the need for a coat of paint on the walls or the deep cleaning needed in the bathroom. The staff seemed young and inexperienced, immature to what Macy's and the tree used to be. Just stopped in for a drink and ended up getting some hummus as well; pretty average-nothing special about it. Definitely not worth what they charged for it. The tree was beautiful though and definitely worth seeing but it seems as though Macy's has stopped putting effort into the holidays. Windows were mediocre-seemed to be a similar theme to the last few years. Maybe they should take the next year and reevaluate themselves, maybe don't put the decorations up at Halloween..
Ok

it's a beautiful restaurant and it's nice to sit by the Xmas tree or to have a view by the windows. the food is Okay, but we mostly go there for the view! this year there was a buffet and the butternut squash tortellini was very good, as well as the meatloaf. I did miss the French dip sandwich they used to have on the menu though!
Our waitress was fabulous. Buffet was had pro's and cons. Christmas decorations are nice. We would visit again.

It's very nice and it is not really Macy's... It is Marshall Field's. Macy's just stuck their bland name on it. Slapping the name "Macy's" on this Chicago landmark is an offense to our history and sensibilities. Macy's....it sounds so common and bland.
Love the Lobster Bisque!
Ah.  Just had to visit during the Christmas eve dinner. Okay food.
Great family tradition. Get there early to get by the tree.
Great staff, and drinks.
Great place the 74 ft Christmas was awsome

We have been to the Walnut Room several times in the past for Christmas with the family in the past, and have always enjoyed great service until this year.  I will say that our waitress was great. She was polite, prompt, and courteous.  Unfortunately, I cannot say the same for most of the rest of the staff we encountered. Additionally, the cleanliness was subpar on this visit.  Many of the staff were pushing their way past the customers shouting "coming through" or "at your back", rather than a more polite caution.  I actually observed that when someone did not move as quickly as they liked, they would actually nudge them with whatever tray or cart they were trying to get past with.  In particular, one waitress pushed her way past me, and my 11 year old son, and then proceeded to keep the tray she was carrying (full of food and drink) pressed against my wife's head while shouting "coming through". There was nowhere for us to go because there was a line of people in front of us as we were trying to leave. It actually hurt my wife's head where the tray was being pressed in.  This is unacceptable behavior and the first time I have observed this level of rudeness there.  When we were first brought to the table (after a 5 hour wait) the hostess wasn't sure which table was supposed to be ours.  She ended us getting seated but there were spilled sauce cups and used napkins around the table.  They did end up cleaning those up once we pointed this out.  I noticed similar cleanliness issues throughout the restaurant as they hurriedly tried to rush people through the dinner service.  Finally, and I acknowledge this was our decision to stay, the idea of a buffet style dinner is not to my liking. I feel that the traditional menu service would make for a more pleasing experience.  Instead, you are left to wait in long lines while also getting pushed past by staff shouting "behind you" while carrying hot containers of food.  This may have been the end of this tradition for my family and I.
Great menu this year!!! A definite must!!!
The food was great.
Great atmosphere! Our family has been going for 57 consecutive years. Definitely recommend for a small family, bigger, and it can get pricey. Merry Christmas!

The room was beautiful and a great buffet. The only ndgative was that we wete setting at a two top table right behind the hostess station and all through out our meal people stood in front of us to have their picture taken. Seeing someones backside through out of meal was not great. I would suggest that one of the tables be taken out so people could still enjoy having their picture taken but not right in front of someone eating.
Perfect place to take a family at Christmas!  The new buffet was great and you can sample everything.  Highly recommend!

Must be under New Management. Had a wonderful experience and excellent food. we almost didn't come back this year because in the past 2yrs we had a bad experience, but they seem to have figured things out. My kids loved the Fairy princesses. All 3 came to our table.
Great place!
Usually the service is impeccable. This time, not so much. But I'm rating them by my experiences as a whole instead of just this one time.
An awesome holiday experience!
Not happy about them switching to buffet. It was hard to navigate across the room to get to the buffet line.
A bit pricy for what it is, but still pretty good.
Beautiful room, ridiculous lines and no reservations on the weekends....
The newly added this year buffet was excellent!

The Walnut room was great! I'd recommend getting the buffet, because then you can get a little bit of everything. They had alot of options which all tasted good. The desert table was also nice, but I'd recommend that you order the desserts from the menu. They also had fairies that granted the kids' whishes.
A wonderful Christmas tradition with great food and better holiday decor!
The food was as good as usual.  The staff super friendly.  This year they have the buffet...super good deal.  Highly recommend the Walnut Room to everyone!!
So beautiful at Christmas. Great service and food.
Great buffet!  Server, Reggie, was excellent.  Enjoyed the ambiance of the room with the tree and the fairies that sprinkle fairy dust to send up your wish.
Great service great place nice food
Very nice
The food here had been lacking for years but I think they're beginning to turn it around.
Buffet was a little dry and chairs had holes everywhere. I was really hoping for more...
Food was good. They now serve buffet style. Wait time is still high.
Amazing place to eat during the holidays
Top people, go out of their way to ensure a good experience.  The food i had was good.  The room did need to be a bit tidier.  Please, clean those floors!
Beautiful interior. Good food. Great holiday stop for the family. Reasonable prices.
Love this place! It's great all year round, but extra special in the Christmas season!
It's tradition!  Very festive. The new buffet was soooooo delicious!
beautiful,  especially at Christmas. They started serving buffet
Great tradition!
I love the new buffet options. Food is hot and ready to go, and it's just as good as I remember it. I'll definately make it a habit of coming back every year if the quality is always this good.

What a meal! What an experience. This is what dining was during the grand age of department stores and a visit and meal in the Walnut Room will have you yearning for those bygone days.  The food is amazing. We had lunch during the Christmas Buffett season and we were not disappointed. The Chicken Pot Pie soup was hands down the best I ever had. The meatloaf was melt in your mouth delicious. The salmon was cooked to perfection!  You owe it to yourself to dine here at least once. The experience alone is worth it. The good is guaranteed to make you want to come back again.
A wonderful tradition at Christmastime every year!

Very dissapointed. For dinner under the tree there is now a buffet rather than a full made to order menu. When asked if a full menu was available i was told that the buffet is a better deal and would be better off doing that. 26$ for adults at this buffet. Very tacky and not at all what the resteraunt should be known for after the many years of great service.
Great Christmas tradition for the family.  Beautiful setting and great brunch buffet.  Perfect for young kids.  Get there just before opening to beat the long wait.
Wait was insane, food was very good and the buffet was fairly priced. Lots of hot food, and service was above average. Tree this year was a little disappointing.
Great service, atmosphere and food.
It was pretty well organized and it didn't seem as crowded as in past years. The buffet was plentiful with lots of good choices!

Made a reservation to eat then had to stand in line to stand in line a second time to eat!!!Didnt think I had to stand in line with a reservation! Soup was barely warm!! My granddaughter said her food was awful! Bad service!! My second granddaughters chicken potpie looked like something from a Dr. Seuss book!! It was green!!!
The Tree! Great brunch, fun cocktails. Our server was Swen we ask for him and he never disappoints

The food made us sick! -- I'm disappointed to say the least. First there was a noticeable amount of white gooey chunky stuff floating in my lemonade. The waiter believed it to be eggnog. The food was "meh" at best. We had our dinners on the table about 4 minutes after ordering, meaning the food is premade and sitting in a warming drawer. The crusted chicken was soggy and tastes like something from a microwave dinner, as did the heat n' serve imitation mashed potatoes that came with it. The chicken pot pie is a bowl of creamy chicken noodle soup with a cold flaky circle shaped crossaint on top to give the illusion that you're getting a real pot pie. The $7.00 slice of pie was good. -- Then for the grande finale, we ended up sick in the bathroom before even leaving the building. I had 2 more trips to the bathroom at the train station as well as up through the night with stomach pains, nausea, headache which is probably from dehydration. We had dinner 14 hours ago and I'm still sick. We won't be back and that breaks mye heart.

Our service was great, the drinks (egg nog brandy Alexander for me) were very good, and the atmosphere was pretty good. Why 3 stars? The food wasn't good. I don't think that anything on the menu was good. Between 6 of us, we had most of what was available.
No question, hands down!  Great service  great food great atmosphere!
Not as good as it once was , a serious let down in service and quality . Still iconic to see the tree .

So, It is an expensive restaurant with mediocre service and a combination of mederately well executed dishes that lack the flair and freshness one would expect from the price point.  Despite these short-comings the Walnut Room is a holiday tradition that relies on the exquisitely decorated tree and visually stunning ambiance to diner interested and present.   Now days, it serves well as a location for fancy cocktails and dessert, but if you want to spend your money on a culinarily interesting menu with signature dishes and memorable food pairings you'd do well to choose one of the many other options Chicago offers to meet these criteria.

What a great experience!!  The tree is stunning and the food is oh so good!  We ate off the menu and friends had the buffet (new this year: $25.00 each).  The buffet has most of the menu on it and more.  My wife and I ordered from the menu ($14.95 each) and we had our food before our friends were back from the buffet.  Service was fast and friendly.  Well worth a date night when you add a German Village stop.
The food is wonderful. There are Christmas fairies who come around and sing and grant wishes during your visit :)
4.5 hour wait. Not worth it.
Love the bar and the tree
Fun trip, nice place.
Great experience

Line system is ridiculous. Even after asking a receptionist,  she directed us to the line that you wait in once you've already put your name on a 3 hour waitlist. A complete waste of time.  Badly run.
Fantastic!
New buffet is awesome
Cool ambience, mediocre buffet
Loved the bautiful Christmas tree in the middle of the restaurant and the fairy walking around granting wishes for the children in the group. The buffet food was just ok.
Food was outstanding as was our server.

This is year four for our group to visit the Walnut Room during the Thanksgiving holiday. We always sit at the bar, have a bite to eat and of course a celebratory holiday beverage! You get to converse with folks you don't know when you're seated at the bar. We've always had wonderful seatmates. Service is great, even with the holiday crush. The servers make it their business to be accommodating and also to create a wonderful atmosphere. There are always the princesses, who tell silly jokes and ask what your wish is. It's the holiday...enjoy.
What a great experience!
Christmas tree and decorations are great. This year was first year they offered buffet option.
We had a wonderful experience Tuesday afternoon for lunch. Kendall took excellent care of us. He went above and beyond to accommodate our special requests. Truly a fantastic meal & service.
Thanks for the great time, great food, and great atmosphere!!!
Such a wonderful place! The service is fantastic!! It is a tradition for me and my mom every year to go there for Christmas!! Love it!!!
A great Christmas tradition for me and my wife.

It was decorated beautifully. I Enjoyed the giant tree and magic fairies visiting the tables. The food was good but there wasnt a good selection of different dishes. Also the desert table had just a couple of options. Service was very fast a kind.

Long wait.  100 degrees.  Bad lighting.  Bad food.  There are some traditions that should die.  Walnut room under the tree is one of those.  If the old Marshall fields building is an indication of how Macy's run's the rest of its stores, they will meet the same demise as Carson's, Sears, etc.

2 hour wait and the food quality worst compared to the past.  This was our 7th time as family,  even more times dating back to mine and my wife's childhood.  The food,  all around subpar in contrast to years past. The manager and staff were great. The manager also indicated multiple customers complaints  due to the Buffett option,  and food sitting.  Our meal was discounted,  staff did their best,  but awful stale mildewish smell towards kitchen area where we sat and food issues,  Macy's needs to be concerned more about quality than speed,  especially when both fail.
Beautiful place. The Christmas tree is awesome

The new buffet is super expensive, even compared to the recent entree price hikes. Hard to take a whole family for a traditional meal anymore. The new non-pager check-in procedure is clunky. The staff working the host/hostess station have as conflicting information and the run-around. That said, the food was still good, and the waiter staff is friendly. If you made a point of going hungry, it might still be a good value. The tree and decor is still,beautiful, but the 8th floor sale has the windowed area above the tree draped in black. Hoping they get some things figured out, or we might skip it next year. *sigh* I miss Field's.

The food and service has improved dramatically. We came here to see the Christmas tree and were impressed with the quality of the buffet. They had plenty of options and the food was excellent and hot. In previous years we were disappointed, but the buffet this year is spot on. The tree is gorgeous and the children and adults in the family loved interacting with the fairies.
Lovely, table ready and set. Delicious food. Servers very helpful
Beautiful as ever
Great food, beautiful restaurant!  While there decorated for Christmas holidays,  gorgeous!

It's a Christmas tradition to have lunch by the tree at the Walnut Room. We love it there! Gave it 4 out of 5 because they went with a buffet format this year and we preferred the old way. Staff was friendly, tree was beautiful, food was good.

It was our first time going. It was FANTASTIC. First, I love that we were able to make reservations (I understand that was not the case in the past). The tree was gorgeous. We enjoyed the buffet, which I understand is also new. It was well worth it, sooo good. There was a variety of food, desserts. I love how there were women dressed as princesses (I forgot what they were calling themselves) that were going around granting wishes-- it added to the magical experience for my little ones, as well as myself. Our waitress... I cannot say enough about her. She was absolutely incredible! Then to top of our experience, we received a cute little mug with the year on it. LOVED it, we'll be back!
waiter dumped our drinks on my dad then the manager went to the wrong table to apologize and compensate.  food/drink wise, not at all good. especially for the exacerbated prices $$$$
One star for decorations. Service, food and cleanliness was terrible.   Very disappointing experience.
Awesome buffet, made return reservations

Not as nice as I remembered. Poor service, food was so so.  My daughter's mac & cheese was the tasty dish of the day. We were seated next to a large empty room of the restaurant. Had random shoppers coming in through the back of the empty room and literally standing next to our table to take pictures of the Tree. The whole meal. Very awkward! Not quite the family memories I was trying to make.
Good food, great service.  Macy's isn't keeping it maintained as they should.  Field's would never have let this happen.  It was actually kind of sad.
Great food the Great Tree is a must see. Our family tradition is a visit here every year.
Service and the view of the tree was amazing but the food not so much.

It’s been a tradition to our family having lunch under the tree around my sister-in-law’s birthday just before Christmas. Chicken Pot Pie is always warming and delicious! The place has the atmosphere that just brings more Christmas spirit to everyone.
This is a great family tradition that we have every year and it just keeps getting bigger and better!!!
Good food, poor service.....4 flat sodas in a row!

Atmosphere was very pretty old school Christmas feel from yesteryear. I went at the beginning of the holiday season during the week staff was nice and attentive however the food from the tree buffet was over priced for bland food.
The new holiday buffet is the most amazing thing ever.  Everything I love about the walnut room and I can have a little of everything.  This is the best thing Macy's has ever done.

I was here on 11/12 around 3pm. It was a beautiful room and had a decent sounding menu. The place wasn't busy by any means and they had plenty of staff standing around. We waited about 30 minutes and during that time we were only giving water. No one introduced themselves as a waiter or took an an order that entire time.  Truly, I wouldnt waste my time here. Instead we walked down the street to Remington's and had a lovely prime rib where they actually gave us an extra 10 oz because it was the last of that cut. Excellent and attentive service there. Great food and a much better experience.  I hope the odds are ever in your favor to actually get service at the Walnut room.
Great place to start or continue family traditions.  Classic and yummy cuisine

Fantastic happy hour deals, and considering the location that's saying a lot.  Found great deals on apps and $5 glasses of wine in a place in the center of the hustle and bustle, but also tucked away enough that you can enjoy yourself.
Great Service, Beautiful this time of year!
Holiday tradition.....lunch with famous Christmas tree and decorations.

Had visitors in from out of state seeing Chicago for the first time so I took them to the walnut room since it’s such a Chicago staple and the tree was already up.  Our reservations were for 3:30, we were seated and then sat there for half an hour without anyone coming to greet us, take drink orders, or food orders. Damn shame because the food looked good but once 4pm rolled around we decided to give somewhere else our money.
Great cultural icon (room and tree) and food /drink were fine.
We go every year to enjoy the Christmas tree. Food for such a big operation is great and the service is enthusiastic and attentive. Very enjoyable experience!
Disappointing. Their website has a full menu, but when we got there we were told it was buffet only for the holidays. The food was not bad, but not really worth the cost.
Went after work.  Drinks and food at bar,  good prices.  The Old fashions were great
The Walnut Room Tree was beautiful.  Had never been before until today.  Food was good.  Service not so great!
Food was decent, staff was nice, things were disorganized.
Excellent happy hour! Quality drinks between $4-$6. Delicious bites. Beautiful classic ambiance. Attentive service
Very nice place for dinner great staff. Nice place to take people and being able to carry on a conversation.
Swank restaurant.  Good but not outstanding food.  You're paying for the atmosphere and location.  Welcome break from Macy's
Classic Chicago. Great atmosphere and amazing service.
Great service
Nice and beautiful place.
Traditional downtown lunch spot..try the Field's Special sandwich...
Best service and good food!
Food is great but service is always horrible
Old school. You need to visit.
Stop making changes. I like it that old way. The pot pie was disappointing.
All the hype about the Walnut Room is a joke. Never again will I bring a group of people there to celebrate any kind of holiday or stepped foot. The food is horrible!
One of fave ritzy places without the price.
We loved it
Very nice. Good food and a nice view
Favorite spot to dine in Chicago for a nice lunch!
Their tea is absolutely AMAZINGLY great. The atmosphere in there was very nice. Every wall was walnut wood. And the food was amazing too. Definitely going back often
It is a beautiful restaurant with good food.
Beautiful room and nice location
Good food at reasonable prices
I am crazy about their Salads
What a delight. A real treat. Good food, decent wine list, excellent service and nice views of the city.
Old school, classic dine. A quiet lunch in the loop, easy to get a table and have a conversation. The classic dishes are classics for a reason. Out of the way and overlooked unfairly.
Great food and service.
A very elegant way to spend a few hours with the family. But, overpriced, and the food does not match the elegance.
We love the Walnut Room. Our second time there and it was great. We highly recommend the iced tea. It's fabulous.

This place is wonderful and filled with history. They have a huge, beautiful fountain in the middle and the room is made of gorgeous Walnut wood. This is a very romantic spot that would be great for big events or ceremonies. Mrs. Herring’s famous pot pie recipe from 1890 is a MUST try!
High Hope's but disappointed. Gorgeous old room operated like a greasy spoon. Reasonable prices. Screaming children and completely noisy room spoil the atmosphere.
Love the 40 plus foot Christmas tree. A yearly visit to Chicago and this wonderful place in Macy's.
Great place to have lunch and the atmosphere and entertainment is great.
Good, fairly mellow place for Mother's Day brunch
Memories from my childhood. My mom would bring me here for lunch back in the 1960's.
Very fancy. The kids love it.
Lot of choices
I ❤️ this place! Especially at Christmas time!
Slow
Old school Chicago dining with tasty comfort foods at reasonable prices. Great drink options at the bar. It is very popular during the fall/winter holidays. Good place for single or family dining.

This place is crazy during the holiday season. The wait time is pretty long if you're there during Christmas time to see the tree. Food is pretty good may take a while if its during the holiday. Off season is like night and day. Servers are …
Its an alright eatery but its lost its classic feel over the years.
Beautiful experience. Classic Chicago Marshall Fields dining.

Go here for Christmas every year, but overall it has tanked and extended family agreed to go elsewhere starting next year. The tree is beautiful, the windows are fun, but isn't enough (coming from far suburbs) to make up for the food that seems like was bought at Sam's Club that morning. Scrambled eggs from powder. Bacon clumped and overcooked. Not enough staff for all the customers. Coffee was cold! Took forever to get drinks refilled. Just overall not the same experience it once was.
Was 5 people in my lunch PARTY. We ordered The blt jam burger , 2 meatloaf mandarine salad and chicken fritters. Service was good food was excellent

The Walnut Room is beautiful and historical. The food is wonderful, so are the drinks. The service leaves something to be desired. We spent 2 hours eating lunch because the service was that slow. But overall it is a good time. I highly recommendthe pot pie or the asiago chicken.

Walked in yesterday (Saturday around 4pm) and attempted to get a table. The restaurant was empty with the exception of 2 tables and 3 guests at the bar. When I approached the host stand the manager, host, and a back of house chef were in the middle of a conversation. I had to wait for them to finish for them to acknowledge that I was there. When I did finally get their attention the host explained to me that there was an hour long wait. It didn't make sense to me that the wait was that long with only 3 tables in the restaurant. The chefs apparently even had enough time to conversate at the host stand. Whatever, I gave them my name and number and they told me they would call me when a table is ready. Before leaving I asked the manager for the restroom, she gave me directions for a restroom that was located away from the restaurant. She did not allow me to use the restroom inside. Upon reaching this bathroom I was greeted with urine soaked walls and feces smeared in the stalls, absolutely disgusting.  And to top it all off, they never called me for my table. This restaurant clearly doesn't want anyone to come in, youre better off taking your business somewhere else. Head a block down onto Michigan avenue where restaurants actually care about service.
It took the waitress three times to get us a real hot cup of coffee, when she finally did, not only it was so strong , but it had a lot of coffee grounds in the bottom of the cups..

Should be 5 stars but the wait to get in, slow service and so-so food drag down the rating.  Regardless, for the short time we lived in Chicagoland, this was a Christmas tradition for us.  It's one of the areas oldest restaurants and is situated in the old Marshall Field building (currently a Macy's). The staff is nice but the crowds make it slow.  The ambiance and huge tree brought us back.  I'd still recommend going.

Came here for lunch. Had the delicious caramelized salmon on risotto with asparagus. Good proportions and price. We sat by the window so had a nice view but was next to the radiator, so it was a tad hot.
Cool place to see, but the food is far from good!
Part of real Chicago.

I decided to take my SO here will he was visiting the city for the first time. I could not think of a better place in Chicago for him to experience the quintessential Chicago-Christmas time atmosphere. We started with some white wine and the potato skins. We both had the chicken pot pie with the spinach side salad. Very delicious! The best part was the seating next to the amazing Christmas tree!

This place was a pleasant surprise. Simple food selection but the food ended up being very nice. Wine selection was good too. Staff was friendly and easy going. Wood panelling decor was warm and inviting and gave the place an up market feel. Although you could be see the place was not as swanky as it probably was in days of old. All up it was a good experience. Good for families too. No complaints. More like a 3.5 rating.
Not worth the wait.
Always a memorable experience!

The worst ever service! We were there 4.5hrs til we finished our meals. We had food spilled on us, hit in the head twice, they forgot 2 meals, & never did they check on us. Horrible horrible. Never again go here. 3rd time this has happened.

Don’t waste you money here!!! It was sooooo bad :(  the food was bad and service was terrible! I’m currently sitting at a table right now and still waiting on some crayons we asked for half an hour ago! The food taste cheap and looks gross. I’m highly annoyed.
Fun experience, really enjoyed the chicken pot pie. The service was very prompt and friendly. Was even granted a wish by a magic fairy.
A Christmas Tradition unlike any other. A good menu - kinda wished they still had the salmon and bread pudding as offerings. A comfortable place to dine with family and friends.
Excellent... all the way around!

Me and my daughter came in to enjoy the experience, it was ok. My daughters salad came out first, and I had to wait a additional 10 minutes for mines to come out. If you like crowded atmospheres this is a place for you. Enjoy...
